snippet: “Firestone and the Warlord,” a 90-minute “Frontline” special Tuesday on PBS, is an example of the reason we bother to scrutinize history.
abstract: Neil Genzlinger reviews ProPublica special Firestone and the Warlord, presented by Frontline on PBS.
lead_paragraph: “Firestone and the Warlord,” a 90-minute “Frontline” special Tuesday on PBS, is an example of the reason we bother to scrutinize history.

headline.seo: ‘Firestone and the Warlord’ Looks at Liberia
headline.main: Bodies Pile Up, but Business Goes On
headline.print_headline: Bodies Pile Up, but Business Goes On
